subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Secularism Isn't Working for Everyone
description: A short lesson to help you apply Secularism Isn't Working for Everyone.

hook.text: Secular societies have more wealth but more loneliness, more freedom but more depression. Something is missing.

buildup.text: Mental health crises, loneliness epidemics, and political extremism rise in the most secular countries. Coincidence?

discovery.text: Religion provided community, ritual, meaning, and moral structure. Secular society offers freedom but no replacements.

twist.text: Some secular thinkers now argue religion was useful even if untrue. We need its benefits without believing its claims.

climax.text: The secular experiment is still young. We left religion behind but haven't yet found what fills the void it left.

punchline.text: Secular society is free but lonely. We left religion without a replacement.

quiz.question: What challenge does secularism face?
options: It hasn't replaced the community, ritual, and meaning that religion provided
